results.title: Blow out
results.creator_credit: David Sims, Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: A light-hearted look at the New Zealanders’ obsession with four wheeled transport, including colourful footage of cars. Provokes ideas about the place of cars in society, as a status symbol and reflection of the owner’s personality.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Sims, Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit

results.title: Blood can work miracles
results.brief_description: An appeal to all in normal health between 18 and 65 to act as regular blood donors, instancing ways in which blood is used to save life, in accident surgery, open heart surgery, using the heart-lung machine, for mother or baby in childbirth emergencies, and in the treatment of anaemias and of burns. Donor sessions are shown to be quite friendly occasions, and the giving of blood painless and without after-effect.

Donor sessions are shown to be quite friendly occasions, and the giving of blood painless and without after-effect.

results.title: [Blood and sand]. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Paul Killiam, Saul J. Turell and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
This is an edited version of the 1922 silent classic “Blood and Sand”, a romantic tragedy about Juan Gallarde, an aspiring bullfighter (Rudolph Valentino), married to his loving childhood sweetheart Carmen (Lila Lee). However, as his fame rises as a matador, so does his hot Spanish blood, and he succumbs to the passionate embraces of the sultry Dona Sol (Nita Naldi). Based on the book “Sangre y Arena” by Vincente Blasco Ibanez and directed by Fred Niblo. This film is intended for students of cinema studies and is part of The History of Motion Picture series. A running commentary is provided throughout the film.

results.title: Blocks (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: G.A. Howe and MacMillan Film Productions
results.brief_description: This film shows how constructive play with blocks of different shapes and sizes can be used to foster the basic perceptive skills and to develop logical thinking, concepts of height, eye-hand co-ordination, symmetry and balance.

results.title: Blinkity blank
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film experiment by Norman McLaren in the use of intermittent animation and spasmodic imagery. McLaren makes play with the laws relating to persistence of vision and after image on the retina of the eye. By engraving non-representational visuals directly on black, emulsion-coated films in interrupted sequence, he achieves a ‘Now you see it, now you don’t effect. The music background is in the form of semi-free instrumental improvisation, with percussive effects added by synthetic sounds scratched directly on film. (Awards: London, Cannes, Edinburgh, Berlin, Los Angeles)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Norman McLaren, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Blindness
results.creator_credit: Morten Parker, Walford Hewitson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The story of a man who lost his sight during the best years of his life. Filmed with the help of the Canadian National Institute for the Blind, this study of blindness tries to show the emotional effect of the sudden loss of sight and how a man so stricken climbs back from the brink of despair. How he learns a trade which enables him to support himself and eventually a family, is a story of quiet triumph convincingly portrayed. Starring Len Cariou
results.creator_credit_for_label: Morten Parker, Walford Hewitson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: A Blind teacher in a public school (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: David Ticchi, Henry Felt and Graduate School of Education, Harvard University
results.brief_description: Shows how one blind man, David Ticchi, carries out his daily responsibilities as a full-time teacher of English. He is seen performing normal tasks required of a classroom teacher, and when interviewed, he explains his teaching methods. Explores the peculiar advantages a blind teacher may bring to a sighted classroom. Includes interviews with David Ticchi’s students and colleagues.

results.title: A Blind child and a sighted child (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Selma H. Fraiberg and University of Michigan. Audio-Visual Education Center
results.brief_description: Follows a blind and a sighted child through the sensori-motor period during the first year of life in an attempt to answer the following questions. How is this crucial period affected when one of the major senses is lacking? What are the pathways of progress for the blind infant? What are the limits set by his handicap?
results.title_for_label: A Blind child and a sighted child (TEFC)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Selma H. Fraiberg and University of Michigan. Audio-Visual Education Center
